properties.areaDesc: Eastern Douglas County Foothills; Jackson County
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 13 at 3:31AM PST until January 14 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
...EXTENDED PERIOD OF WINTER WEATHER CONTINUES...

.Two more systems will impact the region through Tuesday.
Significant snow accumulation will begin around 2000 feet today before
snow levels rise briefly this evening. Snow levels will then fall
to the valley floors Monday night. Snow will continue to
accumulate through Tuesday. Eventually, snow will taper off late
Tuesday evening. More snow will probably impact the Mt Shasta
region and Klamath Mountains late Wednesday and Wednesday night.

* WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning above 3000 feet, heavy snow.
Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 2 feet. Winds gusting as
high as 35 mph over exposed terrain. For the Winter Weather
Advisory between 2000 and 2500 feet, snow expected. Total
accumulations of 4 to 10 inches.

* WHERE...The Winter Storm Warning includes elevations above
3000 feet in Jackson and western Douglas Counties, including
Dead Indian Memorial Road, Tiller-Trail Highway, and Highway
62 north of Prospect. The Winter Weather Advisory covers
elevations between 2000 and 2500 feet, including Butte Falls,
Ruch, the hills surrounding Ashland, Jacksonville Hill, and
portions of Highways 140, 62, and 138.

* WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 10 AM PST Tuesday.
For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 4 AM Monday to 10 AM PST
Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The
hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening
commute.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
* Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions.

* If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets,
food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you.

* The safest place during a winter storm is indoors.

* A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is
occurring and poses a threat to life and property. Take
protective action now.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 3000 FEET... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET
